CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the applicant 's action . The ORG found that it was not competent to deal with the matter which appertained to the jurisdiction of ORG Schätzungskommission ) . The ORG found that the claim for compensation would in any event be unfounded as it had to be directed against other proprietors in the area covered by the zoning plan , rather than the municipality .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed a public - law appeal with ORG in which he complained , on the one hand , about the outcome of the proceedings , on the other , that judge NORP had shortly before acted in separate appeal proceedings , instituted by the applicant , as the legal representative of the opposing party , namely the GPE . Moreover , judge NORP shared office premises with judge PERSON , and also with PERSON who , in separate proceedings instituted by the applicant , had represented the opposing party .

CARDINAL . The public - law appeal was dismissed by ORG on DATE , the decision being served on DATE . In its decision , the court dealt with the applicant 's complaint that certain judges of ORG had not been impartial as follows :

“ The interrelations mentioned may raise certain doubts in view of LAW which requires the impartiality of judges . However , the applicant does not claim that NORP or another member of ORG was in fact biased when giving the contested decision . ORG has already previously held that the fact that legal representatives in the GPE of GPE also acted as part - time administrative court judges could under certain circumstances result in an interrelation of interests . The ORG found , however , that it could be expected from a part - time judge that he could distinguish between his official function and his private professional activities . A part - time judge was not , therefore , obliged to stand down merely because he had represented legal interests in other proceedings which were opposed to those of the applicant ... In view of these principles it can equally not be assumed in the present case that ORG was composed of judges who could be regarded as biased when giving the contested decision . ”
CARDINAL . ORG furthermore did not consider it arbitrary that ORG had found that the applicant 's claims were forfeited as he had failed duly to raise them .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request to reopen the proceedings .
CARDINAL . ORG of the GPE of GPE consists of both full - time and part - time judges , the latter also acting as practising lawyers on a part - time basis .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of ORG ( Verwaltungsrechtspflegegesetz ) of the GPE of GPE of DATE concerns “ incompatibility ” ( GPE ) and stated in the version in force at the relevant time :

“ CARDINAL . NORP The office of a full - time judge of ORG is incompatible with any other full - time professional activity [ hauptberufliche ORG ] . Full - time judges may not be members of ORG nor members or registrars of a municipal or district council . They are not allowed legally to represent third persons before courts and administrative bodies . An authorisation of the cantonal parliament is required if they wish to belong to the administration or management of a commercial company or cooperative acting for commercial purposes .
CARDINAL . NORP Part - time judges may not be employed full - time by an administrative authority or a court , and may not be members or registrars of a municipal or district council . ”
CARDINAL . The Administrative Judiciary Procedure Act was revised in DATE and section CARDINAL now states :

“ CARDINAL . NORP The office of a full - time member of ORG is incompatible both with any other full - time professional activity and with the professional representation of third persons before courts or administrative authorities .
CARDINAL . NORP The office of a part - time member of ORG is incompatible with the professional representation of third persons before ORG ... ”

CARDINAL . In GPE no particular magistrate 's training is required to enter the judicial profession . This explains , inter alia , the comparatively high number of practising lawyers ( legal representatives ) acting as part - time or substitute judges .

ORG has pronounced on various occasions on the question of the impartiality of lawyers acting as judges , in particular the danger of a link of dependency between the judge and one of the parties . For instance , a lawyer may not act as judge in a case where he or she is representing CARDINAL of the parties to the case , or where in separate pending proceedings he or she is representing the opposing party . On the other hand , as a rule no issue will arise where the lawyer once represented a party and the mandate has been completed .
